author: Charles Passy
title: New York Philharmonic Plans Concerts Without a Conductor
text:
Over the course of its 176-year history, the New York Philharmonic has been led by a virtual who’s who of conducting greats, from Arturo Toscanini to Leonard Bernstein.
But for its set of subscription concerts that begins Thursday, the orchestra won’t be tapping a big-name talent to wield the baton. In fact, it won’t be featuring anyone at the podium at all.
The...
